If you do not give your\nfull name and affiliation, it may not be posted. Send\ncommands to subscribe/unsubscribe, get archives, help,\netc. to: majordomo@promedmail.org. For assistance from a\nhuman being send mail to: owner-promed@promedmail.org.\n############################################################\n############################################################", "reports": [{"diseases": ["other", "plague"], "syndromes": [], "event_date": ["2008-01-05 00:00:00", "2007-12-16 00:00:00", "2008-01-10 00:00:00", "1995-03-16 00:00:00", "2008-01-09 00:00:00", "1998-03-16 00:00:00", "1990-03-16 00:00:00", "1990-03-16 00:00:00", "2007-03-16 00:00:00", "2021-03-02 00:00:00", "2006-03-16 00:00:00", "2021-03-03 00:00:00", "2021-03-05 00:00:00", "2021-03-08 00:00:00", "2021-03-07 00:00:00", "2021-03-02 00:00:00", "1997-03-16 00:00:00", "1995-03-16 00:00:00"], "locations": [{"location": "Rasoamanana", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Manjakandriana", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Nebbi District", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Mahajanga", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Ambatolaona", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Ambohitseheno", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Yersinia", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "FATAL", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Madagascar", "country": "unknown"}]}]}, {"archive_id": "93501", "headline": "PRO/AH/EDR> Plague, prairie dog, ferrets - USA: (SD)", "url": "https://promedmail.org/promed-post/?id=93501", "date": "2008-01-11 14:00:13", "main_text": "PLAGUE, FATAL - MADAGASCAR: (ANTANANARIVO), REQUEST FOR INFORMATION\n*********************************************************************\nA ProMED-mail post\n<http://www.promedmail.org>\nProMED-mail is a program of the\nInternational Society for Infectious Diseases\n<http://www.isid.org>\n[1]\nDate: Fri 11 Jan 2008\nSource: L'Express de Madagascar (transl. - Mod.LM) [edited]\n<http://www.lexpressmada.com/display.php>\n\nThe district of Manjakandriana has been confronted with the bubonic\nplague. With the last information communicated by the service of the\ntransmissible disease, the disease has killed, up to now, 3 people.\nIn addition to a 38-year-old man, an inhabitant of Manankasikely and\ndead on 5 Jan 2008, a 12-year-old is also dead in Ambohitseheno. The 3rd\nvictim lived in the rural district of Ambatolaona, and his death\noccurred in December 2007.\nMoreover, as of 10 Jan 2008, 4 men and a woman are under treatment in\nthe hospital complex of the district.\n\"The rats haven't been beaten down. We have rushed a medical team to\nManjakandriana to address the situation,\" said Dr. Rolland Robinson,\nchief of the service of the Emergenies and Transmissible Diseases within\nthe Ministry of Health, Family Planning and Social Protection.\nIn all the cases, the killing of rats are not done, because \"that\nsupports the profusion of the fleas and, so the recrudescence of the\nmalady,\" said Dr. Robinson. He encourages the cleansing of the places\nand the insecticide use.\n[Byline: Fanja Saholiarisoa]\n--\nCommunicated by:\nProMED Rapporteur Dan Silver\n[3 deaths are reported in this press posting but 18 deaths are noted in\nthe web posting below. ProMED would appreciate learning more\ninformation regarding this outbreak.\nMadagascar was the location of the isolation of multi-antimicrobial\nresistant _Y. pestis_ in 1995 (Galimand M, Guiyoule A, Gerbaud G, et al:\nMultidrug resistance in _Yersinia pestis_ mediated by a transferable\nplasmid. N Engl J Med 1997;337: 677-81). The strain was resistant to\nchloramphenicol, streptomycin and tetracycline but sensitive to\nfluoroquinolones and trimethoprim as well as other aminoglycosides. This\nwas an ominous observation, however, it is not clear if this naturally\noccurring strain has persisted or spread.\nManjakandriana is an administrative region in the central Madagascar\nprovince of Antananarivo. The area can be found on a map of the island\nat:\n<http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antananarivo_Province>. - Mod.LL]\n******\n[2]\nDate: Wed 9 Jan 2008\nSource: Les dessous d'information mondiale [edited]\n<http://eldib.wordpress.com/2008/01/10/2175/>\n\nAt least 18 people have died of bubonic plague on the East African\nisland of Madagascar in the past 10 days, and at least 5 patients are\nstill in hospital. Bubonic plague is caused by the _Yersinia pestis_\nbacillus carried by rat fleas.\nAt the start of the rainy season, currently, rats flee the sewers of\nMadagascar in massive numbers and take refuge in people's cottages.\n[The following paragraph of this posting is from 1998 (Chanteau S,\nRatsifasoamanana L, Rasoamanana B, et al: Plague, a Reemerging Disease\nin Madagascar. Emerg Infect Dis 1998;4: 101-104:\n\"Between 1930 and 1990, bubonic plague had \"virtually disappeared\" on\nthe island due to efficient pest-control and good health-management.\nHowever since 1990, an annual 200 cases are being reported and bubonic\nplague takes on epidemic form especially in the port of Mahajanga each\nyear. In the capital city of Antananarivo more cases are also being\nnotified each year since 1990. Madagascar (pop. 13 million) has\naccounted for 45 percent of all the cases of plague in Africa.\"\n- Mod.LL]\n--\nCommunicated by:\nProMED-mail\n<promed@promedmail.org>\nSee Also\n2007\n----\nPlague, fatal - Uganda: (Arua, Nebbi), RFI 20071206.3932\nUndiagnosed deaths - Zambia (02): pneumonic plague susp. 20071130.3862\nPlague - Uganda (Masindi) (03): pneumonic 20070309.0835\nPlague - Uganda (Masindi): pneumonic 20070301.0725\nUndiagnosed deaths - Uganda (Masindi): RFI 20070227.0698\n2006\n----\nPlague, pneumonic - Congo DR (Orientale) (03): WHO 20061108.3208\nPlague, pneumonic - Uganda (Arua) 20061020.3022\nPlague, pneumonic - Congo DR (Orientale): susp., RFI 20061004.2837\nPlague, pneumonic - Congo DR (Ituri) (05): susp., RFI 20060929.2786\nPlague, pneumonic - Congo DR (Ituri) 20060614.1650\n2005\n----\nUndiagnosed deaths - Congo DR (Maniema) (08): pneumonic plague susp\n20050905.2625\nUndiagnosed deaths - Congo DR (Maniema): hem fever susp, RFI\n20050805.2274\nPlague, pneumonic - Congo DR (07): (North East) 20050315.0754\nPlague, pneumonic - Congo DR (Ituri) 20050218.0537\n2004\n----\nPlague - Congo DR (Ituri): susp. 20040730.2083\nPlague - Uganda (Arua, Nebbi) 20040112.0128\n2003\n----\nPlague - Uganda (Arua, Nebbi) (02): background 20031013.2584\nPlague - Uganda (Arua, Nebbi) 20031012.2566\nPlague - Uganda (Arua) 20030331.0794\n2002\n----\nPlague - Uganda (Nebbi District): RFI 20021218.6090\nPlague - Uganda (Arua, Nebbi) 20021130.5938\nPlague, bubonic - Malawi (Nsanje) 20020601.4378\nPlague, bubonic - Malawi, Mozambique 20020510.4160\n1997\n----\nYersinia pestis, antibiotic resistance - Madagascar 19970905.1911\n1996\n----\nPlague - Madagascar 19961023.1790\n1995\n----\nPlague - Madagascar (3) 19951011.0935\nPlague - Madagascar (press report) 19950922.0873\n......................ll/lm/ejp/lm\nThe information transmitted in this electronic communication is intended only\nfor the person or entity to whom it is addressed and may contain confidential\nand/or privileged material. For assistance from a\nhuman being send mail to: owner-promed@promedmail.org.\n############################################################\n############################################################", "reports": [{"diseases": ["other", "plague"], "syndromes": [], "event_date": ["2008-01-05 00:00:00", "2007-12-16 00:00:00", "2008-01-10 00:00:00", "1995-03-16 00:00:00", "2008-01-09 00:00:00", "1998-03-16 00:00:00", "1990-03-16 00:00:00", "1990-03-16 00:00:00", "2007-03-16 00:00:00", "2021-03-02 00:00:00", "2006-03-16 00:00:00", "2021-03-03 00:00:00", "2021-03-05 00:00:00", "2021-03-08 00:00:00", "2021-03-07 00:00:00", "2021-03-02 00:00:00", "1997-03-16 00:00:00", "1995-03-16 00:00:00"], "locations": [{"location": "Rasoamanana", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Manjakandriana", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Nebbi District", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Mahajanga", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Ambatolaona", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Ambohitseheno", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Yersinia", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "FATAL", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Madagascar", "country": "unknown"}]}]}, {"archive_id": "81720", "headline": "PRO/AH/EDR> Plague, feline - USA (WY): mountain lion", "url": "https://promedmail.org/promed-post/?id=81720", "date": "2008-01-11 14:00:13", "main_text": "PLAGUE, FATAL - MADAGASCAR: (ANTANANARIVO), REQUEST FOR INFORMATION\n*********************************************************************\nA ProMED-mail post\n<http://www.promedmail.org>\nProMED-mail is a program of the\nInternational Society for Infectious Diseases\n<http://www.isid.org>\n[1]\nDate: Fri 11 Jan 2008\nSource: L'Express de Madagascar (transl. - Mod.LM) [edited]\n<http://www.lexpressmada.com/display.php>\n\nThe district of Manjakandriana has been confronted with the bubonic\nplague. With the last information communicated by the service of the\ntransmissible disease, the disease has killed, up to now, 3 people.\nIn addition to a 38-year-old man, an inhabitant of Manankasikely and\ndead on 5 Jan 2008, a 12-year-old is also dead in Ambohitseheno. The 3rd\nvictim lived in the rural district of Ambatolaona, and his death\noccurred in December 2007.\nMoreover, as of 10 Jan 2008, 4 men and a woman are under treatment in\nthe hospital complex of the district.\n\"The rats haven't been beaten down. We have rushed a medical team to\nManjakandriana to address the situation,\" said Dr. Rolland Robinson,\nchief of the service of the Emergenies and Transmissible Diseases within\nthe Ministry of Health, Family Planning and Social Protection.\nIn all the cases, the killing of rats are not done, because \"that\nsupports the profusion of the fleas and, so the recrudescence of the\nmalady,\" said Dr. Robinson. He encourages the cleansing of the places\nand the insecticide use.\n[Byline: Fanja Saholiarisoa]\n--\nCommunicated by:\nProMED Rapporteur Dan Silver\n[3 deaths are reported in this press posting but 18 deaths are noted in\nthe web posting below. ProMED would appreciate learning more\ninformation regarding this outbreak.\nMadagascar was the location of the isolation of multi-antimicrobial\nresistant _Y. pestis_ in 1995 (Galimand M, Guiyoule A, Gerbaud G, et al:\nMultidrug resistance in _Yersinia pestis_ mediated by a transferable\nplasmid. N Engl J Med 1997;337: 677-81). The strain was resistant to\nchloramphenicol, streptomycin and tetracycline but sensitive to\nfluoroquinolones and trimethoprim as well as other aminoglycosides. This\nwas an ominous observation, however, it is not clear if this naturally\noccurring strain has persisted or spread.\nManjakandriana is an administrative region in the central Madagascar\nprovince of Antananarivo. The area can be found on a map of the island\nat:\n<http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antananarivo_Province>. - Mod.LL]\n******\n[2]\nDate: Wed 9 Jan 2008\nSource: Les dessous d'information mondiale [edited]\n<http://eldib.wordpress.com/2008/01/10/2175/>\n\nAt least 18 people have died of bubonic plague on the East African\nisland of Madagascar in the past 10 days, and at least 5 patients are\nstill in hospital. Bubonic plague is caused by the _Yersinia pestis_\nbacillus carried by rat fleas.\nAt the start of the rainy season, currently, rats flee the sewers of\nMadagascar in massive numbers and take refuge in people's cottages.\n[The following paragraph of this posting is from 1998 (Chanteau S,\nRatsifasoamanana L, Rasoamanana B, et al: Plague, a Reemerging Disease\nin Madagascar. Emerg Infect Dis 1998;4: 101-104:\n\"Between 1930 and 1990, bubonic plague had \"virtually disappeared\" on\nthe island due to efficient pest-control and good health-management.\nHowever since 1990, an annual 200 cases are being reported and bubonic\nplague takes on epidemic form especially in the port of Mahajanga each\nyear. In the capital city of Antananarivo more cases are also being\nnotified each year since 1990. Madagascar (pop. 13 million) has\naccounted for 45 percent of all the cases of plague in Africa.\"\n- Mod.LL]\n--\nCommunicated by:\nProMED-mail\n<promed@promedmail.org>\nSee Also\n2007\n----\nPlague, fatal - For assistance from a\nhuman being send mail to: owner-promed@promedmail.org.\n############################################################\n############################################################", "reports": [{"diseases": ["other", "plague"], "syndromes": [], "event_date": ["2008-01-05 00:00:00", "2007-12-16 00:00:00", "2008-01-10 00:00:00", "1995-03-16 00:00:00", "2008-01-09 00:00:00", "1998-03-16 00:00:00", "1990-03-16 00:00:00", "1990-03-16 00:00:00", "2007-03-16 00:00:00", "2021-03-02 00:00:00", "2006-03-16 00:00:00", "2021-03-03 00:00:00", "2021-03-05 00:00:00", "2021-03-08 00:00:00", "2021-03-07 00:00:00", "2021-03-02 00:00:00", "1997-03-16 00:00:00", "1995-03-16 00:00:00"], "locations": [{"location": "Rasoamanana", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Manjakandriana", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Nebbi District", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Mahajanga", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Ambatolaona", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Ambohitseheno", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Yersinia", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "FATAL", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Madagascar", "country": "unknown"}]}]}, {"archive_id": "57741", "headline": "PRO/EDR> Plague, pneumonic, fatal - Congo DR: (Orientale), susp.", "url": "https://promedmail.org/promed-post/?id=57741", "date": "2008-01-11 14:00:13", "main_text": "PLAGUE, FATAL - MADAGASCAR: (ANTANANARIVO), REQUEST FOR INFORMATION\n*********************************************************************\nA ProMED-mail post\n<http://www.promedmail.org>\nProMED-mail is a program of the\nInternational Society for Infectious Diseases\n<http://www.isid.org>\n[1]\nDate: Fri 11 Jan 2008\nSource: L'Express de Madagascar (transl. - Mod.LM) [edited]\n<http://www.lexpressmada.com/display.php>\n\nThe district of Manjakandriana has been confronted with the bubonic\nplague. With the last information communicated by the service of the\ntransmissible disease, the disease has killed, up to now, 3 people.\nIn addition to a 38-year-old man, an inhabitant of Manankasikely and\ndead on 5 Jan 2008, a 12-year-old is also dead in Ambohitseheno. The 3rd\nvictim lived in the rural district of Ambatolaona, and his death\noccurred in December 2007.\nMoreover, as of 10 Jan 2008, 4 men and a woman are under treatment in\nthe hospital complex of the district.\n\"The rats haven't been beaten down. We have rushed a medical team to\nManjakandriana to address the situation,\" said Dr. Rolland Robinson,\nchief of the service of the Emergenies and Transmissible Diseases within\nthe Ministry of Health, Family Planning and Social Protection.\nIn all the cases, the killing of rats are not done, because \"that\nsupports the profusion of the fleas and, so the recrudescence of the\nmalady,\" said Dr. Robinson. He encourages the cleansing of the places\nand the insecticide use.\n[Byline: Fanja Saholiarisoa]\n--\nCommunicated by:\nProMED Rapporteur Dan Silver\n[3 deaths are reported in this press posting but 18 deaths are noted in\nthe web posting below. ProMED would appreciate learning more\ninformation regarding this outbreak.\nMadagascar was the location of the isolation of multi-antimicrobial\nresistant _Y. pestis_ in 1995 (Galimand M, Guiyoule A, Gerbaud G, et al:\nMultidrug resistance in _Yersinia pestis_ mediated by a transferable\nplasmid. N Engl J Med 1997;337: 677-81). The strain was resistant to\nchloramphenicol, streptomycin and tetracycline but sensitive to\nfluoroquinolones and trimethoprim as well as other aminoglycosides. This\nwas an ominous observation, however, it is not clear if this naturally\noccurring strain has persisted or spread.\nManjakandriana is an administrative region in the central Madagascar\nprovince of Antananarivo. The area can be found on a map of the island\nat:\n<http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antananarivo_Province>. - Mod.LL]\n******\n[2]\nDate: Wed 9 Jan 2008\nSource: Les dessous d'information mondiale [edited]\n<http://eldib.wordpress.com/2008/01/10/2175/>\n\nAt least 18 people have died of bubonic plague on the East African\nisland of Madagascar in the past 10 days, and at least 5 patients are\nstill in hospital. Bubonic plague is caused by the _Yersinia pestis_\nbacillus carried by rat fleas.\nAt the start of the rainy season, currently, rats flee the sewers of\nMadagascar in massive numbers and take refuge in people's cottages.\n[The following paragraph of this posting is from 1998 (Chanteau S,\nRatsifasoamanana L, Rasoamanana B, et al: Plague, a Reemerging Disease\nin Madagascar. Emerg Infect Dis 1998;4: 101-104:\n\"Between 1930 and 1990, bubonic plague had \"virtually disappeared\" on\nthe island due to efficient pest-control and good health-management.\nHowever since 1990, an annual 200 cases are being reported and bubonic\nplague takes on epidemic form especially in the port of Mahajanga each\nyear. In the capital city of Antananarivo more cases are also being\nnotified each year since 1990. Madagascar (pop. 13 million) has\naccounted for 45 percent of all the cases of plague in Africa.\"\n- Mod.LL]\n--\nCommunicated by:\nProMED-mail\n<promed@promedmail.org>\nSee Also\n2007\n----\nPlague, fatal - Uganda: (Arua, Nebbi), RFI 20071206.3932\nUndiagnosed deaths - Zambia (02): pneumonic plague susp. 20071130.3862\nPlague - Uganda (Masindi) (03): pneumonic 20070309.0835\nPlague - Uganda (Masindi): pneumonic 20070301.0725\nUndiagnosed deaths - Uganda (Masindi): RFI 20070227.0698\n2006\n----\nPlague, pneumonic - Congo DR (Orientale) (03): WHO 20061108.3208\nPlague, pneumonic - Uganda (Arua) 20061020.3022\nPlague, pneumonic - Congo DR (Orientale): susp., RFI 20061004.2837\nPlague, pneumonic - Congo DR (Ituri) (05): susp., RFI 20060929.2786\nPlague, pneumonic - Congo DR (Ituri) 20060614.1650\n2005\n----\nUndiagnosed deaths - Congo DR (Maniema) (08): pneumonic plague susp\n20050905.2625\nUndiagnosed deaths - Congo DR (Maniema): hem fever susp, RFI\n20050805.2274\nPlague, pneumonic - Congo DR (07): (North East) 20050315.0754\nPlague, pneumonic - Congo DR (Ituri) 20050218.0537\n2004\n----\nPlague - Congo DR (Ituri): susp. 20040730.2083\nPlague - Uganda (Arua, Nebbi) 20040112.0128\n2003\n----\nPlague - Uganda (Arua, Nebbi) (02): background 20031013.2584\nPlague - Uganda (Arua, Nebbi) 20031012.2566\nPlague - Uganda (Arua) 20030331.0794\n2002\n----\nPlague - Uganda (Nebbi District): RFI 20021218.6090\nPlague - Uganda (Arua, Nebbi) 20021130.5938\nPlague, bubonic - Malawi (Nsanje) 20020601.4378\nPlague, bubonic - Malawi, Mozambique 20020510.4160\n1997\n----\nYersinia pestis, antibiotic resistance - Madagascar 19970905.1911\n1996\n----\nPlague - Madagascar 19961023.1790\n1995\n----\nPlague - Madagascar (3) 19951011.0935\nPlague - Madagascar (press report) 19950922.0873\n......................ll/lm/ejp/lm\nThe information transmitted in this electronic communication is intended only\nfor the person or entity to whom it is addressed and may contain confidential\nand/or privileged material. With the last information communicated by the service of the\ntransmissible disease, the disease has killed, up to now, 3 people.\nIn addition to a 38-year-old man, an inhabitant of Manankasikely and\ndead on 5 Jan 2008, a 12-year-old is also dead in Ambohitseheno. The 3rd\nvictim lived in the rural district of Ambatolaona, and his death\noccurred in December 2007.\nMoreover, as of 10 Jan 2008, 4 men and a woman are under treatment in\nthe hospital complex of the district.\n\"The rats haven't been beaten down. We have rushed a medical team to\nManjakandriana to address the situation,\" said Dr. Rolland Robinson,\nchief of the service of the Emergenies and Transmissible Diseases within\nthe Ministry of Health, Family Planning and Social Protection.\nIn all the cases, the killing of rats are not done, because \"that\nsupports the profusion of the fleas and, so the recrudescence of the\nmalady,\" said Dr. Robinson. He encourages the cleansing of the places\nand the insecticide use.\n[Byline: Fanja Saholiarisoa]\n--\nCommunicated by:\nProMED Rapporteur Dan Silver\n[3 deaths are reported in this press posting but 18 deaths are noted in\nthe web posting below. ProMED would appreciate learning more\ninformation regarding this outbreak.\nMadagascar was the location of the isolation of multi-antimicrobial\nresistant _Y. pestis_ in 1995 (Galimand M, Guiyoule A, Gerbaud G, et al:\nMultidrug resistance in _Yersinia pestis_ mediated by a transferable\nplasmid. N Engl J Med 1997;337: 677-81). The strain was resistant to\nchloramphenicol, streptomycin and tetracycline but sensitive to\nfluoroquinolones and trimethoprim as well as other aminoglycosides. This\nwas an ominous observation, however, it is not clear if this naturally\noccurring strain has persisted or spread.\nManjakandriana is an administrative region in the central Madagascar\nprovince of Antananarivo. The area can be found on a map of the island\nat:\n<http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antananarivo_Province>. - Mod.LL]\n******\n[2]\nDate: Wed 9 Jan 2008\nSource: Les dessous d'information mondiale [edited]\n<http://eldib.wordpress.com/2008/01/10/2175/>\n\nAt least 18 people have died of bubonic plague on the East African\nisland of Madagascar in the past 10 days, and at least 5 patients are\nstill in hospital. Bubonic plague is caused by the _Yersinia pestis_\nbacillus carried by rat fleas.\nAt the start of the rainy season, currently, rats flee the sewers of\nMadagascar in massive numbers and take refuge in people's cottages.\n[The following paragraph of this posting is from 1998 (Chanteau S,\nRatsifasoamanana L, Rasoamanana B, et al: Plague, a Reemerging Disease\nin Madagascar. Emerg Infect Dis 1998;4: 101-104:\n\"Between 1930 and 1990, bubonic plague had \"virtually disappeared\" on\nthe island due to efficient pest-control and good health-management.\nHowever since 1990, an annual 200 cases are being reported and bubonic\nplague takes on epidemic form especially in the port of Mahajanga each\nyear. In the capital city of Antananarivo more cases are also being\nnotified each year since 1990. Madagascar (pop. 13 million) has\naccounted for 45 percent of all the cases of plague in Africa.\"\n- Mod.LL]\n--\nCommunicated by:\nProMED-mail\n<promed@promedmail.org>\nSee Also\n2007\n----\nPlague, fatal - With the last information communicated by the service of the\ntransmissible disease, the disease has killed, up to now, 3 people.\nIn addition to a 38-year-old man, an inhabitant of Manankasikely and\ndead on 5 Jan 2008, a 12-year-old is also dead in Ambohitseheno. The 3rd\nvictim lived in the rural district of Ambatolaona, and his death\noccurred in December 2007.\nMoreover, as of 10 Jan 2008, 4 men and a woman are under treatment in\nthe hospital complex of the district.\n\"The rats haven't been beaten down. We have rushed a medical team to\nManjakandriana to address the situation,\" said Dr. Rolland Robinson,\nchief of the service of the Emergenies and Transmissible Diseases within\nthe Ministry of Health, Family Planning and Social Protection.\nIn all the cases, the killing of rats are not done, because \"that\nsupports the profusion of the fleas and, so the recrudescence of the\nmalady,\" said Dr. Robinson. He encourages the cleansing of the places\nand the insecticide use.\n[Byline: Fanja Saholiarisoa]\n--\nCommunicated by:\nProMED Rapporteur Dan Silver\n[3 deaths are reported in this press posting but 18 deaths are noted in\nthe web posting below. N Engl J Med 1997;337: 677-81). The strain was resistant to\nchloramphenicol, streptomycin and tetracycline but sensitive to\nfluoroquinolones and trimethoprim as well as other aminoglycosides. This\nwas an ominous observation, however, it is not clear if this naturally\noccurring strain has persisted or spread.\nManjakandriana is an administrative region in the central Madagascar\nprovince of Antananarivo. The area can be found on a map of the island\nat:\n<http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antananarivo_Province>. - Mod.LL]\n******\n[2]\nDate: Wed 9 Jan 2008\nSource: Les dessous d'information mondiale [edited]\n<http://eldib.wordpress.com/2008/01/10/2175/>\n\nAt least 18 people have died of bubonic plague on the East African\nisland of Madagascar in the past 10 days, and at least 5 patients are\nstill in hospital. For assistance from a\nhuman being send mail to: owner-promed@promedmail.org.\n############################################################\n############################################################", "reports": [{"diseases": ["other", "plague"], "syndromes": [], "event_date": ["2008-01-05 00:00:00", "2007-12-16 00:00:00", "2008-01-10 00:00:00", "1995-03-16 00:00:00", "2008-01-09 00:00:00", "1998-03-16 00:00:00", "1990-03-16 00:00:00", "1990-03-16 00:00:00", "2007-03-16 00:00:00", "2021-03-02 00:00:00", "2006-03-16 00:00:00", "2021-03-03 00:00:00", "2021-03-05 00:00:00", "2021-03-08 00:00:00", "2021-03-07 00:00:00", "2021-03-02 00:00:00", "1997-03-16 00:00:00", "1995-03-16 00:00:00"], "locations": [{"location": "Rasoamanana", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Manjakandriana", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Nebbi District", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Mahajanga", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Ambatolaona", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Ambohitseheno", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Yersinia", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "FATAL", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Madagascar", "country": "unknown"}]}]}, {"archive_id": "48346", "headline": "PRO/AH/EDR> Plague, fatal - Madagascar: (Antananarivo), RFI", "url": "https://promedmail.org/promed-post/?id=48346", "date": "2008-01-11 14:00:13", "main_text": "PLAGUE, FATAL - MADAGASCAR: (ANTANANARIVO), REQUEST FOR INFORMATION\n*********************************************************************\nA ProMED-mail post\n<http://www.promedmail.org>\nProMED-mail is a program of the\nInternational Society for Infectious Diseases\n<http://www.isid.org>\n[1]\nDate: Fri 11 Jan 2008\nSource: L'Express de Madagascar (transl. - Mod.LM) [edited]\n<http://www.lexpressmada.com/display.php>\n\nThe district of Manjakandriana has been confronted with the bubonic\nplague. With the last information communicated by the service of the\ntransmissible disease, the disease has killed, up to now, 3 people.\nIn addition to a 38-year-old man, an inhabitant of Manankasikely and\ndead on 5 Jan 2008, a 12-year-old is also dead in Ambohitseheno. The 3rd\nvictim lived in the rural district of Ambatolaona, and his death\noccurred in December 2007.\nMoreover, as of 10 Jan 2008, 4 men and a woman are under treatment in\nthe hospital complex of the district.\n\"The rats haven't been beaten down. We have rushed a medical team to\nManjakandriana to address the situation,\" said Dr. Rolland Robinson,\nchief of the service of the Emergenies and Transmissible Diseases within\nthe Ministry of Health, Family Planning and Social Protection.\nIn all the cases, the killing of rats are not done, because \"that\nsupports the profusion of the fleas and, so the recrudescence of the\nmalady,\" said Dr. Robinson. He encourages the cleansing of the places\nand the insecticide use.\n[Byline: Fanja Saholiarisoa]\n--\nCommunicated by:\nProMED Rapporteur Dan Silver\n[3 deaths are reported in this press posting but 18 deaths are noted in\nthe web posting below. ProMED would appreciate learning more\ninformation regarding this outbreak.\nMadagascar was the location of the isolation of multi-antimicrobial\nresistant _Y. pestis_ in 1995 (Galimand M, Guiyoule A, Gerbaud G, et al:\nMultidrug resistance in _Yersinia pestis_ mediated by a transferable\nplasmid. N Engl J Med 1997;337: 677-81). The strain was resistant to\nchloramphenicol, streptomycin and tetracycline but sensitive to\nfluoroquinolones and trimethoprim as well as other aminoglycosides. This\nwas an ominous observation, however, it is not clear if this naturally\noccurring strain has persisted or spread.\nManjakandriana is an administrative region in the central Madagascar\nprovince of Antananarivo. The area can be found on a map of the island\nat:\n<http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antananarivo_Province>. - Mod.LL]\n******\n[2]\nDate: Wed 9 Jan 2008\nSource: Les dessous d'information mondiale [edited]\n<http://eldib.wordpress.com/2008/01/10/2175/>\n\nAt least 18 people have died of bubonic plague on the East African\nisland of Madagascar in the past 10 days, and at least 5 patients are\nstill in hospital. Bubonic plague is caused by the _Yersinia pestis_\nbacillus carried by rat fleas.\nAt the start of the rainy season, currently, rats flee the sewers of\nMadagascar in massive numbers and take refuge in people's cottages.\n[The following paragraph of this posting is from 1998 (Chanteau S,\nRatsifasoamanana L, Rasoamanana B, et al: Plague, a Reemerging Disease\nin Madagascar. Emerg Infect Dis 1998;4: 101-104:\n\"Between 1930 and 1990, bubonic plague had \"virtually disappeared\" on\nthe island due to efficient pest-control and good health-management.\nHowever since 1990, an annual 200 cases are being reported and bubonic\nplague takes on epidemic form especially in the port of Mahajanga each\nyear. In the capital city of Antananarivo more cases are also being\nnotified each year since 1990. Madagascar (pop. 13 million) has\naccounted for 45 percent of all the cases of plague in Africa.\"\n- Mod.LL]\n--\nCommunicated by:\nProMED-mail\n<promed@promedmail.org>\nSee Also\n2007\n----\nPlague, fatal - Uganda: (Arua, Nebbi), RFI 20071206.3932\nUndiagnosed deaths - Zambia (02): pneumonic plague susp. 20071130.3862\nPlague - Uganda (Masindi) (03): pneumonic 20070309.0835\nPlague - Uganda (Masindi): pneumonic 20070301.0725\nUndiagnosed deaths - Uganda (Masindi): RFI 20070227.0698\n2006\n----\nPlague, pneumonic - Congo DR (Orientale) (03): WHO 20061108.3208\nPlague, pneumonic - Uganda (Arua) 20061020.3022\nPlague, pneumonic - Congo DR (Orientale): susp., RFI 20061004.2837\nPlague, pneumonic - Congo DR (Ituri) (05): susp., RFI 20060929.2786\nPlague, pneumonic - Congo DR (Ituri) 20060614.1650\n2005\n----\nUndiagnosed deaths - Congo DR (Maniema) (08): pneumonic plague susp\n20050905.2625\nUndiagnosed deaths - Congo DR (Maniema): hem fever susp, RFI\n20050805.2274\nPlague, pneumonic - Congo DR (07): (North East) 20050315.0754\nPlague, pneumonic - Congo DR (Ituri) 20050218.0537\n2004\n----\nPlague - Congo DR (Ituri): susp. 20040730.2083\nPlague - Uganda (Arua, Nebbi) 20040112.0128\n2003\n----\nPlague - Uganda (Arua, Nebbi) (02): background 20031013.2584\nPlague - Uganda (Arua, Nebbi) 20031012.2566\nPlague - Uganda (Arua) 20030331.0794\n2002\n----\nPlague - Uganda (Nebbi District): RFI 20021218.6090\nPlague - Uganda (Arua, Nebbi) 20021130.5938\nPlague, bubonic - Malawi (Nsanje) 20020601.4378\nPlague, bubonic - Malawi, Mozambique 20020510.4160\n1997\n----\nYersinia pestis, antibiotic resistance - Madagascar 19970905.1911\n1996\n----\nPlague - Madagascar 19961023.1790\n1995\n----\nPlague - Madagascar (3) 19951011.0935\nPlague - Madagascar (press report) 19950922.0873\n......................ll/lm/ejp/lm\nThe information transmitted in this electronic communication is intended only\nfor the person or entity to whom it is addressed and may contain confidential\nand/or privileged material. For assistance from a\nhuman being send mail to: owner-promed@promedmail.org.\n############################################################\n############################################################", "reports": [{"diseases": ["other", "plague"], "syndromes": [], "event_date": ["2008-01-05 00:00:00", "2007-12-16 00:00:00", "2008-01-10 00:00:00", "1995-03-16 00:00:00", "2008-01-09 00:00:00", "1998-03-16 00:00:00", "1990-03-16 00:00:00", "1990-03-16 00:00:00", "2007-03-16 00:00:00", "2021-03-02 00:00:00", "2006-03-16 00:00:00", "2021-03-03 00:00:00", "2021-03-05 00:00:00", "2021-03-08 00:00:00", "2021-03-07 00:00:00", "2021-03-02 00:00:00", "1997-03-16 00:00:00", "1995-03-16 00:00:00"], "locations": [{"location": "Rasoamanana", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Manjakandriana", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Nebbi District", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Mahajanga", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Ambatolaona", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Ambohitseheno", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Yersinia", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "FATAL", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Madagascar", "country": "unknown"}]}]}, {"archive_id": "42441", "headline": "PRO/AH/EDR> Plague, fatal - China: (Gansu)", "url": "https://promedmail.org/promed-post/?id=42441", "date": "2007-09-24 21:00:10", "main_text": "PLAGUE, BUBONIC - MONGOLIA (GOBISUMBER)\n***************************************\nA ProMED-mail post\n<http://www.promedmail.org>\nProMED-mail is a program of the\nInternational Society for Infectious Diseases\n<http://www.isid.org>\nDate: Thu 20 Sep 2007\nSource: The UB Post [edited]\n<http://ubpost.mongolnews.mn/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=661>\n\nA case of glandular bubonic plague in Gobisumber aimag was confirmed\nthis week. [In Mongolia, an aimag is the 1st level administrative\nsubdivision or province. Each aimag is again subdivided into sums. - Mod.LL]\nA 16-year-old boy in Choir, the capital city of the aimag, showed\nsymptoms of the plague, some days after he had cut his finger while\nskinning a marmot hunted by his father. The marmot is a primary\ncarrier of the plague bacillus in Mongolia.\nThe preliminary diagnosis was confirmed by tests at the National\nCenter for Infectious Disease with Natural Foci (NCIDNF). The boy's\ncondition is now stable, according to local authorities.\n[The Center has sent] 5 veterinary surgeons to Choir to assess the\nsituation. Detailed investigations identified 57 persons with whom\nthe boy came into direct contact during the incubation period. Of\nthem, 54 found in the area were isolated and given preventive medical\ntreatment. [Of these,] 40 have been since released, as they showed no\nsymptoms during the incubation period.\n[Byline: Ch. Sumiyabazar]\n--\nCommunicated by:\nProMED-mail\n<promed@promedmail.org>\n[Uncomplicated bubonic (glandular) plague is not transmissible from\nperson-to-person. It is only when _Yersinia pestis_ bacilli spread to\nthe lungs through a bacteremia or is initially acquired from aerosol\nspread that contacts would be at risk.\nChoir (which is often spelled Tsoir or Chojr) is the capital of the\nprovince of Gobisumber (also spelled Govisumber) and the province in\nMongolia can be found on a map at\n<http://fi.wikipedia.org/wiki/Govisumber>. - Mod.LL]\n[Plague is endemic in Mongolian marmots and their fleas, but as roast\nmarmot (\"boodog\" in Mongolian) is a popular dish there, some unlucky\nhunters catch it every year. See marmot photo at\n<http://www.bobak.ru/pics/view/Marmota%20sibirica.jpg>\nand recipes at\n<http://www.e-mongol.com/mongolia_culture_cooking-recipes.htm>\n- Mod.JW]\nSee Also\nPlague, human, fatal - Mongolia (Hovsgol) (03) 20070810.2602\nPlague, human, fatal - Mongolia (Hovsgol) 20070807.2567\nPlague, rodents - Russia (Volgograd, Astrakhan): susp. 20070128.0368\n2005\n----\nPlague - China (Tibet) 20050626.1798\nPlague, camels - Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan, Turkmenistan: susp. 20050212.0479\n2004\n----\nPlague - Turkmenistan (Dashoguz): susp (02) 20040707.1820\nPlague - Turkmenistan (Dashoguz): susp 20040706.1811\nPlague warning - Russia: RFI 20040427.1178\n2003\n----\nPlague - Mongolia 20030908.2255\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan (Kzyl-Orda) 20030822.2119\nPlague - Kazakhstan (Mangistausk): suspected 20030801.1881\n2002\n----\nPlague - Mongolia 20020919.5361\n2001\n----\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia (Central): correction 20010904.2115\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia (Central) 20010808.1871\n2000\n----\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: background (03) 20000924.1645\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: background (02) 20000920.1620\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: Background 20000802.1290\nPlague, bubonic, marmots - Mongolia: RFI 20000801.1274\n1999\n----\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan (05) 19990817.1418\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan 19990802.1322\n1998\n----\nPlague, marmots - Kyrgyzstan (Dzhetyoguz) 19980811.1572\n........................................ll/mj/jw\n\n*##########################################################*\n************************************************************\nProMED-mail makes every effort to verify the reports that\nare posted, but the accuracy and completeness of the\ninformation, and of any statements or opinions based\nthereon, are not guaranteed. [In Mongolia, an aimag is the 1st level administrative\nsubdivision or province. Each aimag is again subdivided into sums. - Mod.LL]\nA 16-year-old boy in Choir, the capital city of the aimag, showed\nsymptoms of the plague, some days after he had cut his finger while\nskinning a marmot hunted by his father. The marmot is a primary\ncarrier of the plague bacillus in Mongolia.\nThe preliminary diagnosis was confirmed by tests at the National\nCenter for Infectious Disease with Natural Foci (NCIDNF). The boy's\ncondition is now stable, according to local authorities.\n[The Center has sent] 5 veterinary surgeons to Choir to assess the\nsituation. Detailed investigations identified 57 persons with whom\nthe boy came into direct contact during the incubation period. Of\nthem, 54 found in the area were isolated and given preventive medical\ntreatment. [Of these,] 40 have been since released, as they showed no\nsymptoms during the incubation period.\n[Byline: Ch. Sumiyabazar]\n--\nCommunicated by:\nProMED-mail\n<promed@promedmail.org>\n[Uncomplicated bubonic (glandular) plague is not transmissible from\nperson-to-person. It is only when _Yersinia pestis_ bacilli spread to\nthe lungs through a bacteremia or is initially acquired from aerosol\nspread that contacts would be at risk.\nChoir (which is often spelled Tsoir or Chojr) is the capital of the\nprovince of Gobisumber (also spelled Govisumber) and the province in\nMongolia can be found on a map at\n<http://fi.wikipedia.org/wiki/Govisumber>. - Mod.LL]\n[Plague is endemic in Mongolian marmots and their fleas, but as roast\nmarmot (\"boodog\" in Mongolian) is a popular dish there, some unlucky\nhunters catch it every year. See marmot photo at\n<http://www.bobak.ru/pics/view/Marmota%20sibirica.jpg>\nand recipes at\n<http://www.e-mongol.com/mongolia_culture_cooking-recipes.htm>\n- Mod.JW]\nSee Also\nPlague, human, fatal - Mongolia (Hovsgol) (03) 20070810.2602\nPlague, human, fatal - Mongolia (Hovsgol) 20070807.2567\nPlague, rodents - Russia (Volgograd, Astrakhan): susp. 20070128.0368\n2005\n----\nPlague - China (Tibet) 20050626.1798\nPlague, camels - Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan, Turkmenistan: susp. 20050212.0479\n2004\n----\nPlague - Turkmenistan (Dashoguz): susp (02) 20040707.1820\nPlague - Turkmenistan (Dashoguz): susp 20040706.1811\nPlague warning - Russia: RFI 20040427.1178\n2003\n----\nPlague - Mongolia 20030908.2255\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan (Kzyl-Orda) 20030822.2119\nPlague - Kazakhstan (Mangistausk): suspected 20030801.1881\n2002\n----\nPlague - Mongolia 20020919.5361\n2001\n----\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia (Central): correction 20010904.2115\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia (Central) 20010808.1871\n2000\n----\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: background (03) 20000924.1645\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: background (02) 20000920.1620\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: Background 20000802.1290\nPlague, bubonic, marmots - Mongolia: RFI 20000801.1274\n1999\n----\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan (05) 19990817.1418\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan 19990802.1322\n1998\n----\nPlague, marmots - Kyrgyzstan (Dzhetyoguz) 19980811.1572\n........................................ll/mj/jw\n\n*##########################################################*\n************************************************************\nProMED-mail makes every effort to verify the reports that\nare posted, but the accuracy and completeness of the\ninformation, and of any statements or opinions based\nthereon, are not guaranteed. Sumiyabazar]\n--\nCommunicated by:\nProMED-mail\n<promed@promedmail.org>\n[Uncomplicated bubonic (glandular) plague is not transmissible from\nperson-to-person. It is only when _Yersinia pestis_ bacilli spread to\nthe lungs through a bacteremia or is initially acquired from aerosol\nspread that contacts would be at risk.\nChoir (which is often spelled Tsoir or Chojr) is the capital of the\nprovince of Gobisumber (also spelled Govisumber) and the province in\nMongolia can be found on a map at\n<http://fi.wikipedia.org/wiki/Govisumber>. - Mod.LL]\n[Plague is endemic in Mongolian marmots and their fleas, but as roast\nmarmot (\"boodog\" in Mongolian) is a popular dish there, some unlucky\nhunters catch it every year. See marmot photo at\n<http://www.bobak.ru/pics/view/Marmota%20sibirica.jpg>\nand recipes at\n<http://www.e-mongol.com/mongolia_culture_cooking-recipes.htm>\n- Mod.JW]\nSee Also\nPlague, human, fatal - Mongolia (Hovsgol) (03) 20070810.2602\nPlague, human, fatal - Mongolia (Hovsgol) 20070807.2567\nPlague, rodents - Russia (Volgograd, Astrakhan): susp. 20070128.0368\n2005\n----\nPlague - China (Tibet) 20050626.1798\nPlague, camels - Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan, Turkmenistan: susp. 20050212.0479\n2004\n----\nPlague - Turkmenistan (Dashoguz): susp (02) 20040707.1820\nPlague - Turkmenistan (Dashoguz): susp 20040706.1811\nPlague warning - Russia: RFI 20040427.1178\n2003\n----\nPlague - Mongolia 20030908.2255\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan (Kzyl-Orda) 20030822.2119\nPlague - Kazakhstan (Mangistausk): suspected 20030801.1881\n2002\n----\nPlague - Mongolia 20020919.5361\n2001\n----\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia (Central): correction 20010904.2115\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia (Central) 20010808.1871\n2000\n----\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: background (03) 20000924.1645\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: background (02) 20000920.1620\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: Background 20000802.1290\nPlague, bubonic, marmots - Mongolia: RFI 20000801.1274\n1999\n----\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan (05) 19990817.1418\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan 19990802.1322\n1998\n----\nPlague, marmots - Kyrgyzstan (Dzhetyoguz) 19980811.1572\n........................................ll/mj/jw\n\n*##########################################################*\n************************************************************\nProMED-mail makes every effort to verify the reports that\nare posted, but the accuracy and completeness of the\ninformation, and of any statements or opinions based\nthereon, are not guaranteed. [In Mongolia, an aimag is the 1st level administrative\nsubdivision or province. Each aimag is again subdivided into sums. - Mod.LL]\nA 16-year-old boy in Choir, the capital city of the aimag, showed\nsymptoms of the plague, some days after he had cut his finger while\nskinning a marmot hunted by his father. The marmot is a primary\ncarrier of the plague bacillus in Mongolia.\nThe preliminary diagnosis was confirmed by tests at the National\nCenter for Infectious Disease with Natural Foci (NCIDNF). The boy's\ncondition is now stable, according to local authorities.\n[The Center has sent] 5 veterinary surgeons to Choir to assess the\nsituation. Detailed investigations identified 57 persons with whom\nthe boy came into direct contact during the incubation period. Of\nthem, 54 found in the area were isolated and given preventive medical\ntreatment. [Of these,] 40 have been since released, as they showed no\nsymptoms during the incubation period.\n[Byline: Ch. Sumiyabazar]\n--\nCommunicated by:\nProMED-mail\n<promed@promedmail.org>\n[Uncomplicated bubonic (glandular) plague is not transmissible from\nperson-to-person. It is only when _Yersinia pestis_ bacilli spread to\nthe lungs through a bacteremia or is initially acquired from aerosol\nspread that contacts would be at risk.\nChoir (which is often spelled Tsoir or Chojr) is the capital of the\nprovince of Gobisumber (also spelled Govisumber) and the province in\nMongolia can be found on a map at\n<http://fi.wikipedia.org/wiki/Govisumber>. - Mod.LL]\n[Plague is endemic in Mongolian marmots and their fleas, but as roast\nmarmot (\"boodog\" in Mongolian) is a popular dish there, some unlucky\nhunters catch it every year. See marmot photo at\n<http://www.bobak.ru/pics/view/Marmota%20sibirica.jpg>\nand recipes at\n<http://www.e-mongol.com/mongolia_culture_cooking-recipes.htm>\n- Mod.JW]\nSee Also\nPlague, human, fatal - Mongolia (Hovsgol) (03) 20070810.2602\nPlague, human, fatal - Mongolia (Hovsgol) 20070807.2567\nPlague, rodents - Russia (Volgograd, Astrakhan): susp. 20070128.0368\n2005\n----\nPlague - China (Tibet) 20050626.1798\nPlague, camels - Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan, Turkmenistan: susp. 20050212.0479\n2004\n----\nPlague - Turkmenistan (Dashoguz): susp (02) 20040707.1820\nPlague - Turkmenistan (Dashoguz): susp 20040706.1811\nPlague warning - Russia: RFI 20040427.1178\n2003\n----\nPlague - Mongolia 20030908.2255\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan (Kzyl-Orda) 20030822.2119\nPlague - Kazakhstan (Mangistausk): suspected 20030801.1881\n2002\n----\nPlague - Mongolia 20020919.5361\n2001\n----\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia (Central): correction 20010904.2115\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia (Central) 20010808.1871\n2000\n----\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: background (03) 20000924.1645\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: background (02) 20000920.1620\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: Background 20000802.1290\nPlague, bubonic, marmots - Mongolia: RFI 20000801.1274\n1999\n----\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan (05) 19990817.1418\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan 19990802.1322\n1998\n----\nPlague, marmots - Kyrgyzstan (Dzhetyoguz) 19980811.1572\n........................................ll/mj/jw\n\n*##########################################################*\n************************************************************\nProMED-mail makes every effort to verify the reports that\nare posted, but the accuracy and completeness of the\ninformation, and of any statements or opinions based\nthereon, are not guaranteed. For assistance from a\nhuman being send mail to: owner-promed@promedmail.org.\n############################################################\n############################################################", "reports": [{"diseases": ["plague"], "syndromes": [], "event_date": ["2054-03-16 00:00:00", "2003-03-16 00:00:00", "2001-03-16 00:00:00", "1999-03-16 00:00:00", "1998-03-16 00:00:00"], "locations": [{"location": "Turkmenistan", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Astrakhan", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Kazakhstan", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Volgograd", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Choir", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Background", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Yersinia", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Tibet", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Russia", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Mongolia", "country": "unknown"}]}]}, {"archive_id": "28748", "headline": "PRO/AH/EDR> Plague, bubonic - Mongolia (Gobisumber)", "url": "https://promedmail.org/promed-post/?id=28748", "date": "2007-09-24 21:00:10", "main_text": "PLAGUE, BUBONIC - MONGOLIA (GOBISUMBER)\n***************************************\nA ProMED-mail post\n<http://www.promedmail.org>\nProMED-mail is a program of the\nInternational Society for Infectious Diseases\n<http://www.isid.org>\nDate: Thu 20 Sep 2007\nSource: The UB Post [edited]\n<http://ubpost.mongolnews.mn/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=661>\n\nA case of glandular bubonic plague in Gobisumber aimag was confirmed\nthis week. [In Mongolia, an aimag is the 1st level administrative\nsubdivision or province. Each aimag is again subdivided into sums. - Mod.LL]\nA 16-year-old boy in Choir, the capital city of the aimag, showed\nsymptoms of the plague, some days after he had cut his finger while\nskinning a marmot hunted by his father. The marmot is a primary\ncarrier of the plague bacillus in Mongolia.\nThe preliminary diagnosis was confirmed by tests at the National\nCenter for Infectious Disease with Natural Foci (NCIDNF). The boy's\ncondition is now stable, according to local authorities.\n[The Center has sent] 5 veterinary surgeons to Choir to assess the\nsituation. Detailed investigations identified 57 persons with whom\nthe boy came into direct contact during the incubation period. Of\nthem, 54 found in the area were isolated and given preventive medical\ntreatment. [Of these,] 40 have been since released, as they showed no\nsymptoms during the incubation period.\n[Byline: Ch. Sumiyabazar]\n--\nCommunicated by:\nProMED-mail\n<promed@promedmail.org>\n[Uncomplicated bubonic (glandular) plague is not transmissible from\nperson-to-person. It is only when _Yersinia pestis_ bacilli spread to\nthe lungs through a bacteremia or is initially acquired from aerosol\nspread that contacts would be at risk.\nChoir (which is often spelled Tsoir or Chojr) is the capital of the\nprovince of Gobisumber (also spelled Govisumber) and the province in\nMongolia can be found on a map at\n<http://fi.wikipedia.org/wiki/Govisumber>. - Mod.LL]\n[Plague is endemic in Mongolian marmots and their fleas, but as roast\nmarmot (\"boodog\" in Mongolian) is a popular dish there, some unlucky\nhunters catch it every year. See marmot photo at\n<http://www.bobak.ru/pics/view/Marmota%20sibirica.jpg>\nand recipes at\n<http://www.e-mongol.com/mongolia_culture_cooking-recipes.htm>\n- Mod.JW]\nSee Also\nPlague, human, fatal - Mongolia (Hovsgol) (03) 20070810.2602\nPlague, human, fatal - Mongolia (Hovsgol) 20070807.2567\nPlague, rodents - Russia (Volgograd, Astrakhan): susp. 20070128.0368\n2005\n----\nPlague - China (Tibet) 20050626.1798\nPlague, camels - Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan, Turkmenistan: susp. 20050212.0479\n2004\n----\nPlague - Turkmenistan (Dashoguz): susp (02) 20040707.1820\nPlague - Turkmenistan (Dashoguz): susp 20040706.1811\nPlague warning - Russia: RFI 20040427.1178\n2003\n----\nPlague - Mongolia 20030908.2255\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan (Kzyl-Orda) 20030822.2119\nPlague - Kazakhstan (Mangistausk): suspected 20030801.1881\n2002\n----\nPlague - Mongolia 20020919.5361\n2001\n----\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia (Central): correction 20010904.2115\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia (Central) 20010808.1871\n2000\n----\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: background (03) 20000924.1645\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: background (02) 20000920.1620\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: Background 20000802.1290\nPlague, bubonic, marmots - Mongolia: RFI 20000801.1274\n1999\n----\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan (05) 19990817.1418\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan 19990802.1322\n1998\n----\nPlague, marmots - Kyrgyzstan (Dzhetyoguz) 19980811.1572\n........................................ll/mj/jw\n\n*##########################################################*\n************************************************************\nProMED-mail makes every effort to verify the reports that\nare posted, but the accuracy and completeness of the\ninformation, and of any statements or opinions based\nthereon, are not guaranteed. For assistance from a\nhuman being send mail to: owner-promed@promedmail.org.\n############################################################\n############################################################", "reports": [{"diseases": ["plague"], "syndromes": [], "event_date": ["2054-03-16 00:00:00", "2003-03-16 00:00:00", "2001-03-16 00:00:00", "1999-03-16 00:00:00", "1998-03-16 00:00:00"], "locations": [{"location": "Turkmenistan", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Astrakhan", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Kazakhstan", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Volgograd", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Choir", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Background", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Yersinia", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Tibet", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Russia", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Mongolia", "country": "unknown"}]}]}, {"archive_id": "27421", "headline": "PRO/AH/EDR> Plague, feline - USA (NM)", "url": "https://promedmail.org/promed-post/?id=27421", "date": "2007-08-07 16:00:09", "main_text": "PLAGUE, HUMAN, FATAL - MONGOLIA (HOVSGOL)\n*****************************************\nA ProMED-mail post\n<http://www.promedmail.org>\nProMED-mail is a program of the\nInternational Society for Infectious Diseases\n<http://www.isid.org>\nDate: Mon 6 Aug 2007\nSource: Peoples Daily [in Chinese, trans. Rappt.DS, edited]\n<http://world.dayoo.com/gb/content/2007-08/06/content_2889915.htm>\n\nAccording to local media, a 14 year old has died of plague in Tsetserleg\nCounty of Mongolia's Hovsgol Province. On 2 Aug 2007, the child went for\ntreatment at the county hospital due to fever and died that night. Sources\nsay that the deceased contracted plague through contact with a dog on 31\nJul 2007.\nThe Hovsgol Province Infection Prevention and Control Center sent a work\nteam to the area. The area has been closed and 27 individuals with primary\ncontact and 52 with secondary contact have been isolated for observation.\nUp to now none has developed fever.\nMongolia is a high plague incidence region and plague has occurred in\nalmost all provinces. To prevent plague, the Mongolian Government has\nissued prohibitions on marmot hunting. But illicit hunting incidents still\noccur despite repeated prohibitions.\n[byline: Wen Huo]\n--\ncommunicated by:\nProMED-mail rapporteur Dan Silver\n[The clinical manifestations of plague in the adolescent are not stated,\nespecially if pneumonic plague was present. It is also not clear what\nrelationship the dog had in the transmission of _Yersinia pestis_ in this case.\nAn American Veterinary Medical Association reference\n(<http://www.avma.org/reference/zoonosis/znbuboni.asp>), with the citation\nnumbers changed to begin at 1, states:\n\"Generally, the canine family is believed to be more resistant to plague\nthan the feline family and if they develop the disease at all, the disease\nusually is subclinical, that is, not easily recognizable. Wild carnivores\nin the dog family, such as coyotes and foxes, can develop blood titers\nagainst _Y. pestis_ (1,2) Experimentally, dogs inoculated with _Y. pestis_\ndevelop bacteremia and have had _Y. pestis_ isolated for 10 days from the\noropharynx (1). Subclinically and clinically affected dogs can develop\nantibodies against _Y. pestis_ (1), and people have contracted plague after\nskinning infected coyotes and foxes (1,3).\n\"References:\n1. Poland J, Barnes A. Plague. In: Steele JH, ed. CRC handbook series in\nzoonoses Boca Raton, Fla: CRC Press, 1979.\n2. Rust JH jr, Cavanaugh DC, O'Shita R, et al. The role of domestic animals\nin the epidemiology of plague. I. Experimental infection of dogs and cats.\nJ Infect Dis 1971; 124: 522-6 [although a different reference in the same\njournal actually discusses the serologies: The role of domestic animals in\nthe epidemiology of plague. II. Antibody to _Yersinia pestis_ in sera of\ndogs and cats. Rust JH jr, Miller BE, Bahmanyar M, et al. J Infect Dis\n1971; 124: 527-31. - Mod.LL]\n3. Barnes AM. Surveillance and control of bubonic plague in the United\nStates. Symp Zool Soc London 1982.\"\nPlague is endemic in Mongolia. Marmots such as the Tarvaga, the Tarbagan or\nMongolian Marmot _Marmota sibirica_, a large rodent related to the American\nwoodchuck (_M. monax_), are thought to be significant zoonotic reservoirs\nfor _Y. pestis_ in Eastern Asia. The name marmot\n(<http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marmot>) comes from French marmotte, from\nLatin mures monti \"mountain mouse.\"\nA map of the country of Mongolia can be found at\n<http://www.un.org/Depts/Cartographic/map/profile/mongolia.pdf>. The\nprovince of Hovsgol is in the north-central part of the country. - Mod.LL]\nSee Also\nPlague, rodents - Russia (Volgograd, Astrakhan): susp. 20070128.0368\n2005\n---\nPlague - China (Tibet) 20050626.1798\nPlague, camels - Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan, Turkmenistan: susp. 20050212.0479\n2004\n---\nPlague - Turkmenistan (Dashoguz): susp (02) 20040707.1820\nPlague - Turkmenistan (Dashoguz): susp 20040706.1811\nPlague warning - Russia: RFI 20040427.1178\n2003\n---\nPlague - Mongolia 20030908.2255\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan (Kzyl-Orda) 20030822.2119\nPlague - Kazakhstan (Mangistausk): suspected 20030801.1881\n2002\n---\nPlague - Mongolia 20020919.5361\n2001\n---\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia (Central): correction 20010904.2115\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia (Central) 20010808.1871\n2000\n---\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: background (03) 20000924.1645\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: background (02) 20000920.1620\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: Background 20000802.1290\nPlague, bubonic, marmots - Mongolia: RFI 20000801.1274\n1999\n---\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan (05) 19990817.1418\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan 19990802.1322\n1998\n---\nPlague, marmots - Kyrgyzstan (Dzhetyoguz) 19980811.1572\n.................ll/mj/sh\n\n*##########################################################*\n************************************************************\nProMED-mail makes every effort to verify the reports that\nare posted, but the accuracy and completeness of the\ninformation, and of any statements or opinions based\nthereon, are not guaranteed. Rappt.DS, edited]\n<http://world.dayoo.com/gb/content/2007-08/06/content_2889915.htm>\n\nAccording to local media, a 14 year old has died of plague in Tsetserleg\nCounty of Mongolia's Hovsgol Province. On 2 Aug 2007, the child went for\ntreatment at the county hospital due to fever and died that night. Sources\nsay that the deceased contracted plague through contact with a dog on 31\nJul 2007.\nThe Hovsgol Province Infection Prevention and Control Center sent a work\nteam to the area. The area has been closed and 27 individuals with primary\ncontact and 52 with secondary contact have been isolated for observation.\nUp to now none has developed fever.\nMongolia is a high plague incidence region and plague has occurred in\nalmost all provinces. To prevent plague, the Mongolian Government has\nissued prohibitions on marmot hunting. But illicit hunting incidents still\noccur despite repeated prohibitions.\n[byline: Wen Huo]\n--\ncommunicated by:\nProMED-mail rapporteur Dan Silver\n[The clinical manifestations of plague in the adolescent are not stated,\nespecially if pneumonic plague was present. It is also not clear what\nrelationship the dog had in the transmission of _Yersinia pestis_ in this case.\nAn American Veterinary Medical Association reference\n(<http://www.avma.org/reference/zoonosis/znbuboni.asp>), with the citation\nnumbers changed to begin at 1, states:\n\"Generally, the canine family is believed to be more resistant to plague\nthan the feline family and if they develop the disease at all, the disease\nusually is subclinical, that is, not easily recognizable. Wild carnivores\nin the dog family, such as coyotes and foxes, can develop blood titers\nagainst _Y. pestis_ (1,2) Experimentally, dogs inoculated with _Y. pestis_\ndevelop bacteremia and have had _Y. pestis_ isolated for 10 days from the\noropharynx (1). Subclinically and clinically affected dogs can develop\nantibodies against _Y. pestis_ (1), and people have contracted plague after\nskinning infected coyotes and foxes (1,3).\n\"References:\n1. Poland J, Barnes A. Plague. In: Steele JH, ed. CRC handbook series in\nzoonoses Boca Raton, Fla: CRC Press, 1979.\n2. Rust JH jr, Cavanaugh DC, O'Shita R, et al. The role of domestic animals\nin the epidemiology of plague. I. Experimental infection of dogs and cats.\nJ Infect Dis 1971; 124: 522-6 [although a different reference in the same\njournal actually discusses the serologies: The role of domestic animals in\nthe epidemiology of plague. II. Antibody to _Yersinia pestis_ in sera of\ndogs and cats. Rust JH jr, Miller BE, Bahmanyar M, et al. J Infect Dis\n1971; 124: 527-31. - Mod.LL]\n3. Barnes AM. Surveillance and control of bubonic plague in the United\nStates. Symp Zool Soc London 1982.\"\nPlague is endemic in Mongolia. Marmots such as the Tarvaga, the Tarbagan or\nMongolian Marmot _Marmota sibirica_, a large rodent related to the American\nwoodchuck (_M. monax_), are thought to be significant zoonotic reservoirs\nfor _Y. pestis_ in Eastern Asia. The name marmot\n(<http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marmot>) comes from French marmotte, from\nLatin mures monti \"mountain mouse.\"\nA map of the country of Mongolia can be found at\n<http://www.un.org/Depts/Cartographic/map/profile/mongolia.pdf>. The\nprovince of Hovsgol is in the north-central part of the country. - Mod.LL]\nSee Also\nPlague, rodents - Russia (Volgograd, Astrakhan): susp. 20070128.0368\n2005\n---\nPlague - China (Tibet) 20050626.1798\nPlague, camels - Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan, Turkmenistan: susp. 20050212.0479\n2004\n---\nPlague - Turkmenistan (Dashoguz): susp (02) 20040707.1820\nPlague - Turkmenistan (Dashoguz): susp 20040706.1811\nPlague warning - Russia: RFI 20040427.1178\n2003\n---\nPlague - Mongolia 20030908.2255\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan (Kzyl-Orda) 20030822.2119\nPlague - Kazakhstan (Mangistausk): suspected 20030801.1881\n2002\n---\nPlague - Mongolia 20020919.5361\n2001\n---\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia (Central): correction 20010904.2115\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia (Central) 20010808.1871\n2000\n---\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: background (03) 20000924.1645\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: background (02) 20000920.1620\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: Background 20000802.1290\nPlague, bubonic, marmots - Mongolia: RFI 20000801.1274\n1999\n---\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan (05) 19990817.1418\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan 19990802.1322\n1998\n---\nPlague, marmots - Kyrgyzstan (Dzhetyoguz) 19980811.1572\n.................ll/mj/sh\n\n*##########################################################*\n************************************************************\nProMED-mail makes every effort to verify the reports that\nare posted, but the accuracy and completeness of the\ninformation, and of any statements or opinions based\nthereon, are not guaranteed. If you do not give your\nfull name and affiliation, it may not be posted. Send\ncommands to subscribe/unsubscribe, get archives, help,\netc. to: majordomo@promedmail.org. For assistance from a\nhuman being send mail to: owner-promed@promedmail.org.\n############################################################\n############################################################", "reports": [{"diseases": ["plague"], "syndromes": [], "event_date": ["2007-08-02 00:00:00", "2007-03-16 00:00:00", "1979-03-16 00:00:00", "1971-03-16 00:00:00", "1971-03-16 00:00:00", "1982-03-16 00:00:00", "2003-03-16 00:00:00", "2001-03-16 00:00:00", "1999-03-16 00:00:00", "1998-03-16 00:00:00"], "locations": [{"location": "Russia", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Tarbagan", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Cavanaugh DC", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Turkmenistan", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Tsetserleg", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Astrakhan", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "London", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Kazakhstan", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Volgograd", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Boca Raton", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Yersinia", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Hovsgol Province", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "the United \n States", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Tibet", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Poland", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Background", "country": "unknown"}]}]}, {"archive_id": "22379", "headline": "PRO/AH> Plague, wildlife - USA (AZ)", "url": "https://promedmail.org/promed-post/?id=22379", "date": "2007-08-07 16:00:09", "main_text": "PLAGUE, HUMAN, FATAL - MONGOLIA (HOVSGOL)\n*****************************************\nA ProMED-mail post\n<http://www.promedmail.org>\nProMED-mail is a program of the\nInternational Society for Infectious Diseases\n<http://www.isid.org>\nDate: Mon 6 Aug 2007\nSource: Peoples Daily [in Chinese, trans. Rappt.DS, edited]\n<http://world.dayoo.com/gb/content/2007-08/06/content_2889915.htm>\n\nAccording to local media, a 14 year old has died of plague in Tsetserleg\nCounty of Mongolia's Hovsgol Province. On 2 Aug 2007, the child went for\ntreatment at the county hospital due to fever and died that night. Sources\nsay that the deceased contracted plague through contact with a dog on 31\nJul 2007.\nThe Hovsgol Province Infection Prevention and Control Center sent a work\nteam to the area. The area has been closed and 27 individuals with primary\ncontact and 52 with secondary contact have been isolated for observation.\nUp to now none has developed fever.\nMongolia is a high plague incidence region and plague has occurred in\nalmost all provinces. To prevent plague, the Mongolian Government has\nissued prohibitions on marmot hunting. But illicit hunting incidents still\noccur despite repeated prohibitions.\n[byline: Wen Huo]\n--\ncommunicated by:\nProMED-mail rapporteur Dan Silver\n[The clinical manifestations of plague in the adolescent are not stated,\nespecially if pneumonic plague was present. It is also not clear what\nrelationship the dog had in the transmission of _Yersinia pestis_ in this case.\nAn American Veterinary Medical Association reference\n(<http://www.avma.org/reference/zoonosis/znbuboni.asp>), with the citation\nnumbers changed to begin at 1, states:\n\"Generally, the canine family is believed to be more resistant to plague\nthan the feline family and if they develop the disease at all, the disease\nusually is subclinical, that is, not easily recognizable. Wild carnivores\nin the dog family, such as coyotes and foxes, can develop blood titers\nagainst _Y. pestis_ (1,2) Experimentally, dogs inoculated with _Y. pestis_\ndevelop bacteremia and have had _Y. pestis_ isolated for 10 days from the\noropharynx (1). Subclinically and clinically affected dogs can develop\nantibodies against _Y. pestis_ (1), and people have contracted plague after\nskinning infected coyotes and foxes (1,3).\n\"References:\n1. Poland J, Barnes A. Plague. In: Steele JH, ed. CRC handbook series in\nzoonoses Boca Raton, Fla: CRC Press, 1979.\n2. Rust JH jr, Cavanaugh DC, O'Shita R, et al. The role of domestic animals\nin the epidemiology of plague. I. Experimental infection of dogs and cats.\nJ Infect Dis 1971; 124: 522-6 [although a different reference in the same\njournal actually discusses the serologies: The role of domestic animals in\nthe epidemiology of plague. II. Antibody to _Yersinia pestis_ in sera of\ndogs and cats. Rust JH jr, Miller BE, Bahmanyar M, et al. J Infect Dis\n1971; 124: 527-31. - Mod.LL]\n3. Barnes AM. Surveillance and control of bubonic plague in the United\nStates. Symp Zool Soc London 1982.\"\nPlague is endemic in Mongolia. Marmots such as the Tarvaga, the Tarbagan or\nMongolian Marmot _Marmota sibirica_, a large rodent related to the American\nwoodchuck (_M. monax_), are thought to be significant zoonotic reservoirs\nfor _Y. pestis_ in Eastern Asia. The name marmot\n(<http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marmot>) comes from French marmotte, from\nLatin mures monti \"mountain mouse.\"\nA map of the country of Mongolia can be found at\n<http://www.un.org/Depts/Cartographic/map/profile/mongolia.pdf>. The\nprovince of Hovsgol is in the north-central part of the country. - Mod.LL]\nSee Also\nPlague, rodents - Russia (Volgograd, Astrakhan): susp. 20070128.0368\n2005\n---\nPlague - China (Tibet) 20050626.1798\nPlague, camels - Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan, Turkmenistan: susp. 20050212.0479\n2004\n---\nPlague - Turkmenistan (Dashoguz): susp (02) 20040707.1820\nPlague - Turkmenistan (Dashoguz): susp 20040706.1811\nPlague warning - Russia: RFI 20040427.1178\n2003\n---\nPlague - Mongolia 20030908.2255\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan (Kzyl-Orda) 20030822.2119\nPlague - Kazakhstan (Mangistausk): suspected 20030801.1881\n2002\n---\nPlague - Mongolia 20020919.5361\n2001\n---\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia (Central): correction 20010904.2115\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia (Central) 20010808.1871\n2000\n---\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: background (03) 20000924.1645\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: background (02) 20000920.1620\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: Background 20000802.1290\nPlague, bubonic, marmots - Mongolia: RFI 20000801.1274\n1999\n---\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan (05) 19990817.1418\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan 19990802.1322\n1998\n---\nPlague, marmots - Kyrgyzstan (Dzhetyoguz) 19980811.1572\n.................ll/mj/sh\n\n*##########################################################*\n************************************************************\nProMED-mail makes every effort to verify the reports that\nare posted, but the accuracy and completeness of the\ninformation, and of any statements or opinions based\nthereon, are not guaranteed. Rappt.DS, edited]\n<http://world.dayoo.com/gb/content/2007-08/06/content_2889915.htm>\n\nAccording to local media, a 14 year old has died of plague in Tsetserleg\nCounty of Mongolia's Hovsgol Province. On 2 Aug 2007, the child went for\ntreatment at the county hospital due to fever and died that night. Sources\nsay that the deceased contracted plague through contact with a dog on 31\nJul 2007.\nThe Hovsgol Province Infection Prevention and Control Center sent a work\nteam to the area. The area has been closed and 27 individuals with primary\ncontact and 52 with secondary contact have been isolated for observation.\nUp to now none has developed fever.\nMongolia is a high plague incidence region and plague has occurred in\nalmost all provinces. To prevent plague, the Mongolian Government has\nissued prohibitions on marmot hunting. But illicit hunting incidents still\noccur despite repeated prohibitions.\n[byline: Wen Huo]\n--\ncommunicated by:\nProMED-mail rapporteur Dan Silver\n[The clinical manifestations of plague in the adolescent are not stated,\nespecially if pneumonic plague was present. On 2 Aug 2007, the child went for\ntreatment at the county hospital due to fever and died that night. Sources\nsay that the deceased contracted plague through contact with a dog on 31\nJul 2007.\nThe Hovsgol Province Infection Prevention and Control Center sent a work\nteam to the area. The area has been closed and 27 individuals with primary\ncontact and 52 with secondary contact have been isolated for observation.\nUp to now none has developed fever.\nMongolia is a high plague incidence region and plague has occurred in\nalmost all provinces. Surveillance and control of bubonic plague in the United\nStates. Symp Zool Soc London 1982.\"\nPlague is endemic in Mongolia. Marmots such as the Tarvaga, the Tarbagan or\nMongolian Marmot _Marmota sibirica_, a large rodent related to the American\nwoodchuck (_M. monax_), are thought to be significant zoonotic reservoirs\nfor _Y. pestis_ in Eastern Asia. For assistance from a\nhuman being send mail to: owner-promed@promedmail.org.\n############################################################\n############################################################", "reports": [{"diseases": ["plague"], "syndromes": [], "event_date": ["2007-08-02 00:00:00", "2007-03-16 00:00:00", "1979-03-16 00:00:00", "1971-03-16 00:00:00", "1971-03-16 00:00:00", "1982-03-16 00:00:00", "2003-03-16 00:00:00", "2001-03-16 00:00:00", "1999-03-16 00:00:00", "1998-03-16 00:00:00"], "locations": [{"location": "Russia", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Tarbagan", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Cavanaugh DC", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Turkmenistan", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Tsetserleg", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Astrakhan", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "London", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Kazakhstan", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Volgograd", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Boca Raton", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Yersinia", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Hovsgol Province", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "the United \n States", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Tibet", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Poland", "country": "unknown"}, {"location": "Background", "country": "unknown"}]}]}, {"archive_id": "22087", "headline": "PRO/AH/EDR> Plague, human, fatal - Mongolia (Hovsgol) (02)", "url": "https://promedmail.org/promed-post/?id=22087", "date": "2007-08-07 16:00:09", "main_text": "PLAGUE, HUMAN, FATAL - MONGOLIA (HOVSGOL)\n*****************************************\nA ProMED-mail post\n<http://www.promedmail.org>\nProMED-mail is a program of the\nInternational Society for Infectious Diseases\n<http://www.isid.org>\nDate: Mon 6 Aug 2007\nSource: Peoples Daily [in Chinese, trans. Rappt.DS, edited]\n<http://world.dayoo.com/gb/content/2007-08/06/content_2889915.htm>\n\nAccording to local media, a 14 year old has died of plague in Tsetserleg\nCounty of Mongolia's Hovsgol Province. On 2 Aug 2007, the child went for\ntreatment at the county hospital due to fever and died that night. Sources\nsay that the deceased contracted plague through contact with a dog on 31\nJul 2007.\nThe Hovsgol Province Infection Prevention and Control Center sent a work\nteam to the area. The area has been closed and 27 individuals with primary\ncontact and 52 with secondary contact have been isolated for observation.\nUp to now none has developed fever.\nMongolia is a high plague incidence region and plague has occurred in\nalmost all provinces. To prevent plague, the Mongolian Government has\nissued prohibitions on marmot hunting. But illicit hunting incidents still\noccur despite repeated prohibitions.\n[byline: Wen Huo]\n--\ncommunicated by:\nProMED-mail rapporteur Dan Silver\n[The clinical manifestations of plague in the adolescent are not stated,\nespecially if pneumonic plague was present. It is also not clear what\nrelationship the dog had in the transmission of _Yersinia pestis_ in this case.\nAn American Veterinary Medical Association reference\n(<http://www.avma.org/reference/zoonosis/znbuboni.asp>), with the citation\nnumbers changed to begin at 1, states:\n\"Generally, the canine family is believed to be more resistant to plague\nthan the feline family and if they develop the disease at all, the disease\nusually is subclinical, that is, not easily recognizable. Wild carnivores\nin the dog family, such as coyotes and foxes, can develop blood titers\nagainst _Y. pestis_ (1,2) Experimentally, dogs inoculated with _Y. pestis_\ndevelop bacteremia and have had _Y. pestis_ isolated for 10 days from the\noropharynx (1). Subclinically and clinically affected dogs can develop\nantibodies against _Y. pestis_ (1), and people have contracted plague after\nskinning infected coyotes and foxes (1,3).\n\"References:\n1. Poland J, Barnes A. Plague. In: Steele JH, ed. CRC handbook series in\nzoonoses Boca Raton, Fla: CRC Press, 1979.\n2. Rust JH jr, Cavanaugh DC, O'Shita R, et al. The role of domestic animals\nin the epidemiology of plague. I. Experimental infection of dogs and cats.\nJ Infect Dis 1971; 124: 522-6 [although a different reference in the same\njournal actually discusses the serologies: The role of domestic animals in\nthe epidemiology of plague. II. Antibody to _Yersinia pestis_ in sera of\ndogs and cats. Rust JH jr, Miller BE, Bahmanyar M, et al. J Infect Dis\n1971; 124: 527-31. - Mod.LL]\n3. Barnes AM. Surveillance and control of bubonic plague in the United\nStates. Symp Zool Soc London 1982.\"\nPlague is endemic in Mongolia. Marmots such as the Tarvaga, the Tarbagan or\nMongolian Marmot _Marmota sibirica_, a large rodent related to the American\nwoodchuck (_M. monax_), are thought to be significant zoonotic reservoirs\nfor _Y. pestis_ in Eastern Asia. The name marmot\n(<http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marmot>) comes from French marmotte, from\nLatin mures monti \"mountain mouse.\"\nA map of the country of Mongolia can be found at\n<http://www.un.org/Depts/Cartographic/map/profile/mongolia.pdf>. The\nprovince of Hovsgol is in the north-central part of the country. - Mod.LL]\nSee Also\nPlague, rodents - Russia (Volgograd, Astrakhan): susp. 20070128.0368\n2005\n---\nPlague - China (Tibet) 20050626.1798\nPlague, camels - Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan, Turkmenistan: susp. 20050212.0479\n2004\n---\nPlague - Turkmenistan (Dashoguz): susp (02) 20040707.1820\nPlague - Turkmenistan (Dashoguz): susp 20040706.1811\nPlague warning - Russia: RFI 20040427.1178\n2003\n---\nPlague - Mongolia 20030908.2255\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan (Kzyl-Orda) 20030822.2119\nPlague - Kazakhstan (Mangistausk): suspected 20030801.1881\n2002\n---\nPlague - Mongolia 20020919.5361\n2001\n---\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia (Central): correction 20010904.2115\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia (Central) 20010808.1871\n2000\n---\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: background (03) 20000924.1645\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: background (02) 20000920.1620\nPlague, bubonic - Mongolia & China: Background 20000802.1290\nPlague, bubonic, marmots - Mongolia: RFI 20000801.1274\n1999\n---\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan (05) 19990817.1418\nPlague, bubonic - Kazakhstan 19990802.1322\n1998\n---\nPlague, marmots - Kyrgyzstan (Dzhetyoguz) 19980811.1572\n.................ll/mj/sh\n\n*##########################################################*\n************************************************************\nProMED-mail makes every effort to verify the reports that\nare posted, but the accuracy and completeness of the\ninformation, and of any statements or opinions based\nthereon, are not guaranteed. Rappt.DS, edited]\n<http://world.dayoo.com/gb/content/2007-08/06/content_2889915.htm>\n\nAccording to local media, a 14 year old has died of plague in Tsetserleg\nCounty of Mongolia's Hovsgol Province. On 2 Aug 2007, the child went for\ntreatment at the county hospital due to fever and died that night. Sources\nsay that the deceased contracted plague through contact with a dog on 31\nJul 2007.\nThe Hovsgol Province Infection Prevention and Control Center sent a work\nteam to the area. The area has been closed and 27 individuals with primary\ncontact and 52 with secondary contact have been isolated for observation.\nUp to now none has developed fever.\nMongolia is a high plague incidence region and plague has occurred in\nalmost all provinces. To prevent plague, the Mongolian Government has\nissued prohibitions on marmot hunting. But illicit hunting incidents still\noccur despite repeated prohibitions.\n[byline: Wen Huo]\n--\ncommunicated by:\nProMED-mail rapporteur Dan Silver\n[The clinical manifestations of plague in the adolescent are not stated,\nespecially if pneumonic plague was present.
